user_question: How can I capture the Milky Way with my DSLR camera, and can you generate an image of a starry night sky?
final_answer: To capture the Milky Way with a DSLR: Use a wide-angle lens, set ISO to 1600-3200, aperture to f/2.8, and shutter speed to 20-30 seconds. Image of a starry night sky generated. The best time to photograph the Milky Way is from April to September, during a new moon.
